original_solution_mapping.L1: On Monday Miriam does 5 push-ups + 7 push-ups on Tuesday = <<5+7=12>>12 push-ups on both days.
original_solution_mapping.L2: On Wednesday she does twice as many push-ups as she did on Tuesday, 7 x 2 = <<7*2=14>>14 push-ups on Wednesday.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Over the first 3 days, she did a total of 14 + 12 = <<14+12=26>>26 pushups
original_solution_mapping.L4: On Thursday Miriam did 1/2 the same number of total pushups she had already done that week, so she did 1/2 x 26 = <<1/2*26=13>>13 pushups on Thursday.
original_solution_mapping.L5: On Friday she does as many push-ups as the total of what she had done over the previous four days, so she did 5 + 7 + 14 + 13 = <<5+7+14+13=39>>39 push-ups on Friday.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1826.
    Returns: the number of pushups Miriam does on Friday.
    """
    # L1
    monday_pushups = 5 # On Monday she does 5 push-ups
    tuesday_pushups = 7 # On Tuesday she does 7 push-ups
    monday_tuesday_total = monday_pushups + tuesday_pushups

    # L2
    wednesday_multiplier = 2 # twice as many push-ups
    wednesday_pushups = tuesday_pushups * wednesday_multiplier

    # L3
    total_first_three_days = wednesday_pushups + monday_tuesday_total

    # L4
    thursday_fraction = 0.5 # half the number of total pushups
    thursday_pushups = thursday_fraction * total_first_three_days

    # L5
    friday_pushups = monday_pushups + tuesday_pushups + wednesday_pushups + thursday_pushups

    # FA
    answer = friday_pushups
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: On Monday Miriam does {monday_pushups} push-ups + {tuesday_pushups} push-ups on Tuesday = <<{monday_pushups}+{tuesday_pushups}={monday_tuesday_total}>>{monday_tuesday_total} push-ups on both days.

On Wednesday she does twice as many push-ups as she did on Tuesday, {tuesday_pushups} x {wednesday_multiplier} = <<{tuesday_pushups}*{wednesday_multiplier}={wednesday_pushups}>>{wednesday_pushups} push-ups on Wednesday.
Over the first 3 days, she did a total of {wednesday_pushups} + {monday_tuesday_total} = <<{wednesday_pushups}+{monday_tuesday_total}={total_first_three_days}>>{total_first_three_days} pushups

On Thursday Miriam did {thursday_fraction} the same number of total pushups she had already done that week, so she did {thursday_fraction} x {total_first_three_days} = <<{thursday_fraction}*{total_first_three_days}={thursday_pushups}>>{thursday_pushups} pushups on Thursday.

On Friday she does as many push-ups as the total of what she had done over the previous four days, so she did {monday_pushups} + {tuesday_pushups} + {wednesday_pushups} + {thursday_pushups} = <<{monday_pushups}+{tuesday_pushups}+{wednesday_pushups}+{thursday_pushups}={friday_pushups}>>{friday_pushups} push-ups on Friday.
